member.name: T:JetBrains.Decompiler.Transformations.Assignment.ExtractArrayCompoundAssignmentTransformation

member.name: T:JetBrains.Decompiler.Transformations.Delegates.ExtractStaticallyCachedAnonymousDelegateTransformation
member.summary:
Block $branch: ... if $cachedDelegate == null then goto $then else goto $else
Block $then: $cachedDelegate = new $delegateType($bodyMethod); Goto $else
Block $else: ...$cachedDelegate$... ...
->
Block $branch: ... Goto $else
Block $else: ...($delegateType) delegate $body... ...
The final usage is optional.

summary.para:
Somewhere:
$cachedDelegate = ($delegateType) null;

Block $branch: ... if $cachedDelegate == null then goto $then else goto $else
Block $then: $cachedDelegate = new $delegateType(this.$bodyMethod); Goto $else
Block $else: ...$cachedDelegate$... ...
->
Block $branch: ... Goto $else
Block $else: ...($delegateType) delegate $body... ...
The final usage is optional.
!op_False($1) -> $1 in a context where a boolean-expression is expected (see 7.20).
op_False($1) -> $1 ? false : true in all contexts.

member.param: An input type to be boxed.

summary.para: ($evaluationType) $lhs $op ($evaluationType) $rhs -> ($binaryOperationType) (($enumType) $lhs $op ($enumType) $rhs) where $op is one of &, |, ^, +, -, ==, !=, >, >=, <, <=.
In certain cases type casts may be different.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Decompiler.Transformations.Iterators.IteratorDecompiler.ExtractYieldReturn(JetBrains.Decompiler.ControlFlow.ControlFlowBlock,JetBrains.Decompiler.Ast.IReturnStatement)

summary.para: Empty base() call is eliminated. Also instance field initializers are extracted.
$1 as $2 != null -> $1 is $2

member.name: T:JetBrains.Decompiler.Transformations.Assignment.ExtractIndexerPostfixTransformation
member.summary:
($targetCopy = $target)[$indexCopy1 = $index[1], ..., $indexCopy[n] = $index[n]] = ($lhsType) (($evaluationType) ($temp = $targetCopy[$indexCopy1, ..., $indexCopy[n]]) $op 1)
->
$temp = $target[$index[1], ..., $index[n]]++
where $op is either or . Typecasts involving $lhsType and $evaluationType are optional.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Decompiler.Transformations.Assignment.ExtractSimplePostfixTransformation

summary.para: $expr += 1 -> ++$expr
$expr -= 1 -> --$expr

member.name: T:JetBrains.Decompiler.Transformations.Assignment.ExtractIndexerCompoundAssignmentTransformation
member.summary:
($targetCopy = $target)[$indexCopy1 = $index[1], ..., $indexCopy[n] = $index[n]] = ($lhsType) (($evaluationType) $targetCopy[$indexCopy1, ..., $indexCopy[n]] op $rhs)
->
$target[$index[1], ..., $index[n]] op= $rhs
Typecasts involving $lhsType and $evaluationType are optional.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Decompiler.Transformations.Assignment.ExtractArrayPrefixTransformation
member.remarks: This pattern is only used by unsafe code for incrementing or decrementing pointers.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Decompiler.Transformations.Unsafe.ExtractFixedStatementTransformation

summary.para: ((IntPtr) $lhs - (IntPtr) $rhs) / $size -> (IntPtr) (($elementType*) $lhs - ($elementType*) $rhs))
$elementType is selected based on the types of $lhs, $rhs and $size
(IntPtr) $lhs $op $delta -> (IntPtr) (($properUnderlyingType*) $lhs + $rhs)
where $lhs is a pointer or reference type with a given $underlyingType and $op is either + or -.

Let $size be the static size of $underlyingType (if known). The following cases are possible for $delta:
$delta is an literal divisible by $size. In this case $rhs is (IntPtr) ($delta / $size) (which will be treated by later) and $properUnderlyingType is $underlyingType.
$delta is an literal not divisible by $size. In this case $rhs is $delta and $properUnderlyingType is byte.
$delta is (IntPtr) $recordCount * sizeof($properUnderlyingType). In this case $rhs is $recordCount and $properUnderlyingType is derived from the above.
$delta is (IntPtr) sizeof($properUnderlyingType). In this case $rhs is 1 and $properUnderlyingType is derived from the above.
$size of $underlyingType is known statically and $delta is (IntPtr) $recordCount * $size. In this case $rhs is $recordCount and $properUnderlyingType is $underlyingType.
$size of $underlyingType is 1 and $delta is (IntPtr) $recordCount. In this case $rhs is $recordCount and $properUnderlyingType is $underlyingType.
($evaluationType) $lhs $op ($evaluationType)$ rhs -> $lhs $op $rhs
where $op is ==, !=, <, <=, >, >=, $lhs and $rhs are pointers, and $evaluationType is either a pointer, a reference, or .

member.name: T:JetBrains.Decompiler.Transformations.Unsafe.ExtractReferencePinTransformation

summary.para: $pinned = (string) null; -> __unpin($newPinned);
Each reference to $charPointer is replaced by ($charPointerType) $newPinned.
($type[1]) ... ($type[n]) ($pointer1 - $pointer2) -> ($type[1]) ($pointer1 - $pointer2)
where $type[i] is either IntPtr, UIntPtr, long, or ulong.
*$pointer -> $pointer[0]
where $pointer is either a fixed or stackalloc array.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Decompiler.Transformations.UserDefinedOperators.ExtractSimplePostfixExpressionTransformation
T:JetBrains.Decompiler.Transformations.UserDefinedOperators.ExtractSimplePrefixTransformation

summary.para:
Conditional and:
Block $branch: ... $result = $lhs; If op_True($result) then goto $done else goto $evaluate
Block $evaluate: $rhsTemp = $rhs; $result &= $rhsTemp; Goto $done
->
Block $branch: ... $result = $lhs || $rhs; Goto $done
Block $branch: ... $result = $lhs; If op_False($result) then goto $done else goto $evaluate
Block $evaluate: $rhsTemp = $rhs; $result = $result & $rhsTemp; Goto $done
->
Block $branch: ... $result = $lhs && $rhs; Goto $done
op_True($1) -> $1 in a context where a boolean-expression is expected (see 7.20).
op_True($1) -> $1 ? true : false in all contexts.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Decompiler.Transformations.Using.ExtractNotNullableUsingTransformation

summary.para: Make implicit each deref of the form ^$1 where $1 is a parameter variable having or a this reference in a value type.
Replace all other references $1 to such variables with @^$1 where deref is implicit.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Decompiler.Transformations.Exceptions.CombineTryCatchFinallyTransformation
member.summary:
try { try $1 } finally $2
->
try $1 finally $2
provided that the inner try statement has no finally or fault block.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Decompiler.Transformations.Exceptions.EliminateCatchVariableTransformation
member.summary: catch (object $1) -> catch if $1 is not used

member.name: T:JetBrains.Decompiler.Render.CSharp.ExpressionPrecedence
member.summary: Used to omit redundant braces during pretty-printing. Names borrowed from 7.3.1.

members.member:
($1) $2 == ($1) $3 -> $2 == $3 ($1) $2 != ($1) $3 -> $2 != $3
when the following conditions are met:
the types of $2 and $3 are same and numeric
the basic types of $1, $2, and $3 are the same

($1) $2 == $3 -> $2 == $3 ($1) $2 != $3 -> $2 != $3
when the following conditions are met:
the types of $2 and $3 are same and numeric
the basic types of $1, $2, and $3 are the same

summary.para: Let $local be a local with the only reference.
Remove $local = $constExpr;.
$local = $call -> $call
$local = $call ? 1 : 0 -> $call
$1 <= null -> $1 == null
$1 > null -> $1 != null

member.name: T:JetBrains.Decompiler.Transformations.Loops.ExtractIndexForEachTransformation
member.summary:
$1 list = $2; for (int index = 0; index < list.Length; ++index) $3
->
foreach ($4 item in list) $3
Here $4 is the element type of list, $3 contains the only read usage of index, namely of the form list[index]. The latter usage is replaced by item.

summary.para: Find rational approximation to given real number
David Eppstein / UC Irvine / 8 Aug 1993. With corrections from Arno Formella, May 2008.
Based on the theory of continued fractions. if x = a1 + 1/(a2 + 1/(a3 + 1/(a4 + ...))) then best approximation is found by truncating this series (with some adjustments in the last term).
Note the fraction can be recovered as the first column of the matrix
Instead of keeping the sequence of continued fraction terms, we just keep the last partial product of these matrices.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Decompiler.DataFlow.UsageType.Read
member.summary:
Normal read usage, like in
Console.WriteLine(foo);

member.name: T:JetBrains.Decompiler.Transformations.Arithmetic.ReducePlusMinusTransformation
member.summary:
$1 + c -> $1 - (-c) c + $1 -> $1 - (c)
for a negative constant c

member.name: T:JetBrains.Decompiler.Transformations.Bool.SimplifyBoolLiteralComparisonTransformation
member.summary:
(int) $1 == 1 -> $1 (and vice versa)
(int) $1 == 0 -> !$1 (and vice versa)
(int) $1 != 0 -> $1 (and vice versa)
(int) $1 != 1 -> !$1 (and vice versa)
where $1 is typed as bool
